page.title: 19ETTRICK VALLEY TOURISM.
page.content: In the valley there are two caravan parks and they are open from March to October.They are open that time because in the Winter the weather is too cold for tourists.Both the parks are mostly static caravans but there is some room for tourers and tents.You can also go fishing in the river Ettrick or the Tima and at the top of the Tima valley here is a small loch where you can hire a rowing boat.There is a lot of walking on the forest roads and there is also the Southern Upland Way by which you can walk over the hills to St.Mary's Loch.The Southern Upland Way starts in the West at Portpatrick and finishes at Cockburnspath in the North-East.Quite nearby there is a Pony Trekking Centre.Peace and Quiet are the main attractions.
